metadata.dc:description: Plantar fasciitis, a self-limiting pathologic entity, is a common cause of heel pain in adult patients. Surgical treatment is indicated when the patient does not improve after receiving conservative treatment for 4-6 months with proper surveillance. The complications of percutaneous techniques include: infection, persistent pain, and neurologic injuries, among others. We report the case of a patient with calcaneus fracture following percutaneous plantar fasciotomy and resection of a calcaneal spur. We conducted a review and discussion of the literature.
metadata.dc:title: Fractura de calcáneo como complicación de tratamiento percutáneo de fascitis plantar. Reporte de un caso.
[Calcaneus fractures as a complication of the percutaneous treatment of plantar fasciitis. Case report].
